AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Kemel-Ze researcher
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was lucky enough to be allowed access to Kemel-Ze, thanks to a rather influential friend. The ruins were a truly marvellous spectacle, [PAWN_nameDef] could spend years in there, and still find new things to study. Of course [PAWN_pronoun] had a habit of getting in the way of the Imperial Archaeological Societies work, not that [PAWN_pronoun] really cared.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: bonewalker creator
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] spent quite some time in the holy city of Necrom, as [PAWN_pronoun] created bonewalkers. Not exactly the most pleasant job, as improper storage of the corpses had somewhat undesirable results.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: bonewalker creator
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] spent quite some time in the holy city of Necrom, as [PAWN_nameDef] created bonewalkers. [PAWN_pronoun] always became annoyed when outlanders claimed the art of bonewalker creation was necromancy, and as such should be outlawed. 'Becoming a bonewalker is considered by many Dunmer to be an honour', [PAWN_nameDef] always exasperatedly shouted, though this usually fell on deaf ears. Incidents like this usually left [PAWN_nameDef] a rambling mess for a few days.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: master bonewalker creator
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] spent many years reading through the texts kept in Necrom, many years studying the corpses sent to be prepared for burial, and many years perfecting the art of bonewalker creation. Needless to say, [PAWN_nameDef] may be one of the most skilled bonewalker creators to have ever existed.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: dissident priest
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.description: Once a loyal servant of the Tribunal Temple, [PAWN_nameDef] eventually learned the truth, the true events that transpired at the battle of Red Mountain. [PAWN_pronoun] tried to talk to [PAWN_possessive] peers, to help them see the light. But eventually grew anxious, as the Ordinators seemed to be closing in. So [PAWN_nameDef] fled to Holamayan, and awaited the visitation of the Incarnate.
